Posts.Content: JJC44 wrote: Hi Everyone, I've been on the sideline reading the boards since originally diagnosed in December 2008 with Triple Negative IDC in left breast but this is my first post.  I completed surgery, chemo and radiation in 2009.  In Feb/March 2010,  I felt a lump at the base of my neck above collarbone and  I had a CT scan on March 10 and was told that it showed "something" and was then sent for PET scan.  I got the results today and they weren't good.  Onc said PET showed activity in several lymph nodes, the bones in arms, hips, back, and in my liver.  He is recommending Xeloda-4 pills a day, 2 in the morning/2 evening, Zometa for bones and Ixempra chemo.  Does this sound like the best treatment for my first time in recurrance?  Any help would be appreciated because I am so scared! Dx 12/29/2008 Log in to post a reply
